Claim: Passengers at Delhi airport got agitated Wednesday morning as their passports were withheld by airport authorities.
Explaination: This incident took place a few days back at IGIA in relation to mandatory coronavirus screening
Label: half true
html:
Claim: Passengers at Delhi airport got agitated Wednesday morning as their passports were withheld by airport authorities.

Explanation:This incident took place a few days back at IGIA in relation to mandatory coronavirus screening

Claim: An image with human body figurines in a bowl that claims China is serving human baby soup in its restaurants.
Explaination: The image is of an art installation to raise awareness about the rampant killing of sharks.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An image with human body figurines in a bowl that claims China is serving human baby soup in its restaurants.

Explanation:The image is of an art installation to raise awareness about the rampant killing of sharks.

Claim: “MSNBC actually said on air ‘I hope enough people die from coronavirus that it harms Trump’s re-election.’”
Explaination: MSNBC panelists compared former President George W. Bush’s response to Hurricane Katrina to President Donald Trump’s response to the coronavirus outbreak, and speculated it could hurt his popularity.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “MSNBC actually said on air ‘I hope enough people die from coronavirus that it harms Trump’s re-election.’”

Explanation:MSNBC panelists compared former President George W. Bush’s response to Hurricane Katrina to President Donald Trump’s response to the coronavirus outbreak, and speculated it could hurt his popularity.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/18/facebook-posts/no-msnbc-didnt-say-it-hopes-coronavirus-kills-enou/

Claim: A meme shows an image of fully stocked shelves of toilet paper, purportedly during the 2009 H1N1 outbreak, above barren shelves during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.
Explaination: The post is misleading; the image of the stocked shelves is a screenshot from US news footage shot this year, not in 2009.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A meme shows an image of fully stocked shelves of toilet paper, purportedly during the 2009 H1N1 outbreak, above barren shelves during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.

Explanation:The post is misleading; the image of the stocked shelves is a screenshot from US news footage shot this year, not in 2009.

https://factcheck.afp.com/meme-does-not-show-fully-stocked-shelves-during-swine-flu-pandemic

Claim: Infected taxi driver demands money from his government otherwise he’ll infect others.
Explaination: Story originated from a parody account, no driver is threatneing to spread covid-19 across Nigeria.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Infected taxi driver demands money from his government otherwise he’ll infect others.

Explanation:Story originated from a parody account, no driver is threatneing to spread covid-19 across Nigeria.

https://factcheck.afp.com/story-originated-parody-account-no-driver-threatening-spread-covid-19-across-nigeria

Claim: The Taiwanese flag is printed on masks to prevent the Chinese from buying them.
Explaination: Production of the mask with the national flag started at the latest in 2019. There is no relationship with this coronavirus. Posts posted as "jokes" on Taiwanese Internet bulletin boards have spread.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The Taiwanese flag is printed on masks to prevent the Chinese from buying them.

Explanation:Production of the mask with the national flag started at the latest in 2019. There is no relationship with this coronavirus. Posts posted as "jokes" on Taiwanese Internet bulletin boards have spread.

https://www.buzzfeed.com/jp/kotahatachi/unknown-cause-china-4

Claim: A post with a photo claiming that an Italian mother, suffering from COVID-19, hugs her baby
Explaination: The viral image is an old image, The mother is suffering from cancer and was clicked post her radiotherapy when she could not hug her child.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A post with a photo claiming that an Italian mother, suffering from COVID-19, hugs her baby

Explanation:The viral image is an old image, The mother is suffering from cancer and was clicked post her radiotherapy when she could not hug her child.

https://myanmar.factcrescendo.com/fact-check-post-with-a-photo-claiming-that-an-italian-mother-suffering-covid-19-infection-hugs-her-baby/

Claim: A video shows domesticated and exotic animals being sold in a wet market in Wuhan, China.
Explaination: The video currently being spread on social media is a composite of two different clips, one of Langowan Traditional Market and the other of Tomohon Traditional Market, both in Indonesia.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows domesticated and exotic animals being sold in a wet market in Wuhan, China.

Explanation:The video currently being spread on social media is a composite of two different clips, one of Langowan Traditional Market and the other of Tomohon Traditional Market, both in Indonesia.

https://verafiles.org/articles/vera-files-fact-check-video-bats-snakes-other-animals-sold-w

Claim: Photo of Iranian officials visiting the vice president after she contracted COVID-19.
Explaination: The photo has circulated in reports since 2014, after one of Iran's vice-presidents was injured in a traffic accident.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Photo of Iranian officials visiting the vice president after she contracted COVID-19.

Explanation:The photo has circulated in reports since 2014, after one of Iran's vice-presidents was injured in a traffic accident.

https://factcheck.afp.com/photo-has-circulated-reports-2014-after-one-irans-vice-presidents-was-injured-traffic-accident

Claim: Hospital is caught using a dummy in pandemic footage.
Explaination: Footage was for training on how to use ventilators.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Hospital is caught using a dummy in pandemic footage.

Explanation:Footage was for training on how to use ventilators.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/fact-check-hospital-caught-red-handed-using-dummies-in-pandemic-footage.html

Claim: Video shows a WHO official inappropriately touching a female attendee during a briefing session in China about the novel coronavirus outbreak in Wuhan. Same video was also used with another claim that the man is an Australian politician.
Explaination:
Video was taken out of context. The man in the video is a 2006 Nobel Prize laureate in physics, Professor George Smoot, not someone from WHO or a politician.
The clip shows Smoot attending a business conference in Julu County in Hebei Province in China in June 2018 with his significant other who was having a sore back at the time.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Video shows a WHO official inappropriately touching a female attendee during a briefing session in China about the novel coronavirus outbreak in Wuhan. Same video was also used with another claim that the man is an Australian politician.

Explanation:Video was taken out of context. The man in the video is a 2006 Nobel Prize laureate in physics, Professor George Smoot, not someone from WHO or a politician. The clip shows Smoot attending a business conference in Julu County in Hebei Province in China in June 2018 with his significant other who was having a sore back at the time.

https://medium.com/annie-lab/false-this-video-does-not-show-a-who-official-touching-a-female-conference-attendee-in-china-1da782cd49e4

Claim: A photo of a young boy has been shared repeatedly on Facebook, Twitter and various websites alongside a claim that it shows a 13-year-old who died after contracting the novel coronavirus in the UK in 2020.
Explaination: The claim is false; the photograph has circulated in reports since 2017 about a teenager who died in Ireland.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photo of a young boy has been shared repeatedly on Facebook, Twitter and various websites alongside a claim that it shows a 13-year-old who died after contracting the novel coronavirus in the UK in 2020.

Explanation:The claim is false; the photograph has circulated in reports since 2017 about a teenager who died in Ireland.

https://factcheck.afp.com/photo-has-circulated-reports-about-irish-teenager-who-died-2017

Claim: Six coronavirus cases confirmed in Wichita, Kansas.
Explaination: No cases were confirmed there, and claim came from non-credible websites.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Six coronavirus cases confirmed in Wichita, Kansas.

Explanation:No cases were confirmed there, and claim came from non-credible websites.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471725-fake-news-breaking-news-six-coronavirus-cases-confirmed-in-wichita-kansas.html

Claim: A post shows a rail freight tanker with “COVID-19” stamped on one side.
Explaination: The image has circulated globally but it is false, the tanker operating company said. And Railinc, a corporation that manages an industry-wide database, said there is no such mark as “COVID.”
Label: False
html:
Claim: A post shows a rail freight tanker with “COVID-19” stamped on one side.

Explanation:The image has circulated globally but it is false, the tanker operating company said. And Railinc, a corporation that manages an industry-wide database, said there is no such mark as “COVID.”

https://factcheck.afp.com/photo-covid-19-rail-tanker-not-genuine-0

Claim: “THE CHINESE HAVE BEGUN TO USE THEIR HUMAN CORPSE TO PROCESS INTO PRODUCTS SUCH AS CORNED BEEF TO SHIP TO AFRICA. Please share with your contacts. Very important”
Explaination: The video might be of Tibet or China’s Sichuan as residents of both these territories perform such rituals. However, we haven’t found the origin of this claim hence we can not emphasize whether or not visuals in this video belong to Sky Burial. But from our findings it is evident that the video is in no way related to the coronavirus outbreak.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “THE CHINESE HAVE BEGUN TO USE THEIR HUMAN CORPSE TO PROCESS INTO PRODUCTS SUCH AS CORNED BEEF TO SHIP TO AFRICA. Please share with your contacts. Very important”

Explanation:The video might be of Tibet or China’s Sichuan as residents of both these territories perform such rituals. However, we haven’t found the origin of this claim hence we can not emphasize whether or not visuals in this video belong to Sky Burial. But from our findings it is evident that the video is in no way related to the coronavirus outbreak.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_14817124

Claim: Claim that an American soldier was intentionally spreading the novel coronavirus in Wuhan during the seventh CISM Military World Games in October 2019 with a video clip of a man purportedly smearing saliva on the handrail on a train.
Explaination: The video is authentic but it was taken in Brussels, Belgium, on March 10, 2020. The man is not an American. According to media reports, the man was arrested by the police on the same day.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Claim that an American soldier was intentionally spreading the novel coronavirus in Wuhan during the seventh CISM Military World Games in October 2019 with a video clip of a man purportedly smearing saliva on the handrail on a train.

Explanation:The video is authentic but it was taken in Brussels, Belgium, on March 10, 2020. The man is not an American. According to media reports, the man was arrested by the police on the same day.

https://medium.com/annie-lab/misleading-this-video-does-not-show-an-american-soldier-spreading-saliva-in-wuhan-a1ee9b7b816

Claim: Riots in London due to the unavailability of food items. The United Kingdom will be locked down by tonight. Army soldiers take to the UK streets.
Explaination: The video is not related to coronavirus but with London riots that happened in 2011. The 2011 England riots, more widely known as the London Riots, were a series of riots between 6 and 11 August 2011, when thousands of people rioted in cities and towns across England, saw looting, arson, and mass deployment of police, and resulted in the deaths of five people.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Riots in London due to the unavailability of food items. The United Kingdom will be locked down by tonight. Army soldiers take to the UK streets.

Explanation:The video is not related to coronavirus but with London riots that happened in 2011. The 2011 England riots, more widely known as the London Riots, were a series of riots between 6 and 11 August 2011, when thousands of people rioted in cities and towns across England, saw looting, arson, and mass deployment of police, and resulted in the deaths of five people.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15320709?check=5

Claim: If you donate blood, “they HAVE to test you” for coronavirus.
Explaination: Blood donors don’t get a coronavirus test if they donate blood.
Label: False
html:
Claim: If you donate blood, “they HAVE to test you” for coronavirus.

Explanation:Blood donors don’t get a coronavirus test if they donate blood.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/13/viral-image/no-blood-donors-dont-automatically-get-coronavirus/

Claim: A video shows a bat-infested roof in Hubei, China, claiming to be the source of the new coronavirus.
Explaination: This video dates back to 2011, which is almost 9 years ago. This video is from Miami, Florida, USA and has nothing to do with Novel coronavirus and China.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows a bat-infested roof in Hubei, China, claiming to be the source of the new coronavirus.

Explanation:This video dates back to 2011, which is almost 9 years ago. This video is from Miami, Florida, USA and has nothing to do with Novel coronavirus and China.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/chinas-source-for-coronavirus/

Claim: Several photographs published on Facebook claim to portray coffins with victims of the new coronavirus in Italy.
Explaination: The pictures were taken in april 2009, after an earthquake in L'Aquila, that killed 308 people.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Several photographs published on Facebook claim to portray coffins with victims of the new coronavirus in Italy.

Explanation:The pictures were taken in april 2009, after an earthquake in L'Aquila, that killed 308 people.

Claim: Fire triggered by gas tanker leak near Delhi’s Shahdara Mor.
Explaination: Video is not from Delhi but Lahore's Shahdara Mor in Pakistan.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Fire triggered by gas tanker leak near Delhi’s Shahdara Mor.

Explanation:Video is not from Delhi but Lahore's Shahdara Mor in Pakistan.

Claim: Rs 2000 notes scattered in Delhi to spread Coronavirus infection.
Explaination: The incident has no connection with COVID-19, A person accidentally dropped some currency notes and later returned to claim the same, which was handed to him by the local police team.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Rs 2000 notes scattered in Delhi to spread Coronavirus infection.

Explanation:The incident has no connection with COVID-19, A person accidentally dropped some currency notes and later returned to claim the same, which was handed to him by the local police team.

Claim: High levels of sulfur dioxide in Wuhan “may be a sign of mass cremations of victims of the coronavirus.”
Explaination: The photo shows sulfur dioxide projections. It is not a real-time satellite image.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: High levels of sulfur dioxide in Wuhan “may be a sign of mass cremations of victims of the coronavirus.”

Explanation:The photo shows sulfur dioxide projections. It is not a real-time satellite image.

Claim: A video shows a truck dropping bodies covered with plastic into a ditch and claiming that this is the situation in Italy right now.
Explaination: The video which is being widely circulated on social media is not from Italy. It is a movie scene that had been taken from a 2007 US television miniseries 'Pandemic'.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows a truck dropping bodies covered with plastic into a ditch and claiming that this is the situation in Italy right now.

Explanation:The video which is being widely circulated on social media is not from Italy. It is a movie scene that had been taken from a 2007 US television miniseries 'Pandemic'.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15472289

Claim: A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple Facebook, YouTube and Twitter posts alongside a claim it shows the Islamic call to prayer being heard in Spain during the COVID-19 epidemic for the first time in 500 years.
Explaination: The claim is false; the video was filmed in Azerbaijan in November 2019, before the COVID-19 pandemic; there has been no ban on the Islamic call to prayer in Spain in recent times.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple Facebook, YouTube and Twitter posts alongside a claim it shows the Islamic call to prayer being heard in Spain during the COVID-19 epidemic for the first time in 500 years.

Explanation:The claim is false; the video was filmed in Azerbaijan in November 2019, before the COVID-19 pandemic; there has been no ban on the Islamic call to prayer in Spain in recent times.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-was-filmed-azerbaijan-november-2019

Claim: Walmart is closing hundreds of its stores.
Explaination: This story is several years old, and there has been no recent announcement.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Walmart is closing hundreds of its stores.

Explanation:This story is several years old, and there has been no recent announcement.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3472009-Fact-Check-Walmart-NOT-Closing-Stores-At-Present-Time.html

Claim: A claim that 500 body bags were delivered to an ice skating rink outside the Australian city of Adelaide has been shared widely on Facebook during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The claim is false; South Australian health authorities said the claim is a “myth” and a spokesperson for the local ice rink said “the rumour is completely false”.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A claim that 500 body bags were delivered to an ice skating rink outside the Australian city of Adelaide has been shared widely on Facebook during the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The claim is false; South Australian health authorities said the claim is a “myth” and a spokesperson for the local ice rink said “the rumour is completely false”.

https://factcheck.afp.com/its-myth-south-australian-health-authorities-dismiss-rumour-about-ice-rink-turned-morgue-covid-19

Claim: Two Filipinos ate bat soup in Wuhan, China, the epicenter of the 2019 novel coronavirus (nCoV), as seen in a video uploaded on Facebook.
Explaination: The original video was taken in Palau and was uploaded on YouTube on July 17, 2019 – at least 5 months before a case of the 2019-nCoV was first reported in Wuhan, China.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Two Filipinos ate bat soup in Wuhan, China, the epicenter of the 2019 novel coronavirus (nCoV), as seen in a video uploaded on Facebook.

Explanation:The original video was taken in Palau and was uploaded on YouTube on July 17, 2019 – at least 5 months before a case of the 2019-nCoV was first reported in Wuhan, China.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/251715-video-filipinos-eating-bats-wuhan-china

Claim: Doctors and nurses in Italy are dying and are lying dead on the ground due to the coronavirus outbreak.
Explaination: The image does not depict dead doctors and nurses in Italy. It is a part of a demonstration by youngsters to spread awareness about coronavirus in Bogota.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Doctors and nurses in Italy are dying and are lying dead on the ground due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Explanation:The image does not depict dead doctors and nurses in Italy. It is a part of a demonstration by youngsters to spread awareness about coronavirus in Bogota.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/03/24/fact-check-image-showing-doctors-and-nurses-dead-in-italy/

Claim: This photo shows a Sri Lankan airline pilot who tested positive for the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is false; the local health authority told AFP the pilot is not pictured in the photo; the man wrongly identified in the posts denied the claim.
Label: False
html:
Claim: This photo shows a Sri Lankan airline pilot who tested positive for the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is false; the local health authority told AFP the pilot is not pictured in the photo; the man wrongly identified in the posts denied the claim.

https://factcheck.afp.com/photo-does-not-show-pilot-who-tested-positive-after-visiting-cricket-game-sri-lanka

Claim: Italy official Giulio Gallera: China lies to us. The date China provided is false. Italy has become Wuhan and the medical system has a breakdown.
Explaination: The Health and Welfare Regional Minister in Lombardy, Giulio Gallera, didn't give such statements in the interview.
Label: Partially false
html:
Claim: Italy official Giulio Gallera: China lies to us. The date China provided is false. Italy has become Wuhan and the medical system has a breakdown.

Explanation:The Health and Welfare Regional Minister in Lombardy, Giulio Gallera, didn't give such statements in the interview.

https://tfc-taiwan.org.tw/articles/3162

Claim: Over 200 doctors in Italy die every day due to coronavirus.
Explaination: The total number of doctors in Italy who died due to the coronavirus is 66 as of Thursday, April 2.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Over 200 doctors in Italy die every day due to coronavirus.

Explanation:The total number of doctors in Italy who died due to the coronavirus is 66 as of Thursday, April 2.
